#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=III

#Text=At Carnival time , in the sixth year of Sergius ’s life at the hermitage , a merry company of rich people , men and women from a neighbouring town , made up a troyka-party , after a meal of carnival-pancakes and wine .
#Text=The company consisted of two lawyers , a wealthy landowner , an officer , and four ladies .

#Text=One lady was the officer ’s wife , another the wife of the landowner , the third his sister -- a young girl -- and the fourth a divorcee , beautiful , rich , and eccentric , who amazed and shocked the town by her escapades .
#Text=The weather was excellent and the snow-covered road smooth as a floor .
#Text=They drove some seven miles out of town , and then stopped and consulted as to whether they should turn back or drive farther .
#Text=‘ But where does this road lead to ? ’ asked Makovkina , the beautiful divorcee .
#Text=‘ To Tambov , eight miles from here , ’ replied one of the lawyers , who was having a flirtation with her .
#Text=‘ And then where ? ’
#Text=‘ Then on to L -- -- , past the Monastery . ’
#Text=‘ Where that Father Sergius lives ? ’
#Text=‘ Yes . ’
#Text=‘ Kasatsky , the handsome hermit ? ’
#Text=‘ Yes . ’
#Text=‘ Mesdames et messieurs , let us drive on and see Kasatsky !
#Text=We can stop at Tambov and have something to eat . ’
#Text=‘ But we should n’t get home to-night ! ’
#Text=‘ Never mind , we will stay at Kasatsky ’s . ’
#Text=‘ Well , there is a very good hostelry at the Monastery .
#Text=I stayed there when I was defending Makhin . ’
#Text=‘ No , I shall spend the night at Kasatsky ’s ! ’
#Text=‘ Impossible !
#Text=Even your omnipotence could not accomplish that ! ’
#Text=‘ Impossible ?
#Text=Will you bet ? ’
#Text=‘ All right ! If you spend the night with him , the stake shall be whatever you like . ’
#Text=‘ A DISCRETION ! ’
#Text=‘ But on your side too ! ’
#Text=‘ Yes , of course .
#Text=Let us drive on . ’
#Text=Vodka was handed to the drivers , and the party got out a box of pies , wine , and sweets for themselves .
#Text=The ladies wrapped up in their white dogskins .
#Text=The drivers disputed as to whose troyka should go ahead , and the youngest , seating himself sideways with a dashing air , swung his long knout and shouted to the horses .
#Text=The troyka-bells tinkled and the sledge-runners squeaked over the snow .
#Text=The sledge swayed hardly at all .

#Text=The shaft-horse , with his tightly bound tail under his decorated breechband , galloped smoothly and briskly ; the smooth road seemed to run rapidly backwards , while the driver dashingly shook the reins .

#Text=One of the lawyers and the officer sitting opposite talked nonsense to Makovkina ’s neighbour , but Makovkina herself sat motionless and in thought , tightly wrapped in her fur . ‘ Always the same and always nasty ! The same red shiny faces smelling of wine and cigars !
#Text=The same talk , the same thoughts , and always about the same things !
#Text=And they are all satisfied and confident that it should be so , and will go on living like that till they die .
#Text=But I ca n’t .
#Text=It bores me .
#Text=I want something that would upset it all and turn it upside down .
#Text=Suppose it happened to us as to those people -- at Saratov was it ?
#Text=-- who kept on driving and froze to death ... .
#Text=What would our people do ?
#Text=How would they behave ?
#Text=Basely , for certain . Each for himself .
#Text=And I too should act badly .
#Text=But I at any rate have beauty .
#Text=They all know it .
#Text=And how about that monk ?
#Text=Is it possible that he has become indifferent to it ?
#Text=No !
#Text=That is the one thing they all care for -- like that cadet last autumn .
#Text=What a fool he was ! ’
#Text=‘ Ivan Nikolaevich ! ’ she said aloud .
#Text=‘ What are your commands ? ’
#Text=‘ How old is he ? ’
#Text=‘ Who ? ’
#Text=‘ Kasatsky . ’
#Text=‘ Over forty , I should think . ’
#Text=‘ And does he receive all visitors ? ’
#Text=‘ Yes , everybody , but not always . ’
#Text=‘ Cover up my feet .
#Text=Not like that -- how clumsy you are ! No !
#Text=More , more -- like that !
#Text=But you need not squeeze them ! ’
#Text=So they came to the forest where the cell was .
#Text=Makovkina got out of the sledge , and told them to drive on .
#Text=They tried to dissuade her , but she grew irritable and ordered them to go on .
#Text=When the sledges had gone she went up the path in her white dogskin coat .
#Text=The lawyer got out and stopped to watch her .
#Text=It was Father Sergius ’s sixth year as a recluse , and he was now forty-nine .
#Text=His life in solitude was hard -- not on account of the fasts and the prayers ( they were no hardship to him ) but on account of an inner conflict he had not at all anticipated .
#Text=The sources of that conflict were two : doubts , and the lust of the flesh .
#Text=And these two enemies always appeared together .
#Text=It seemed to him that they were two foes , but in reality they were one and the same .
#Text=As soon as doubt was gone so was the lustful desire .
#Text=But thinking them to be two different fiends he fought them separately .
#Text=‘ O my God , my God ! ’ thought he . ‘ Why dost thou not grant me faith ?
#Text=There is lust , of course : even the saints had to fight that -- Saint Anthony and others .
#Text=But they had faith , while I have moments , hours , and days , when it is absent .
#Text=Why does the whole world , with all its delights , exist if it is sinful and must be renounced ? Why hast Thou created this temptation ?
#Text=Temptation ?

#Text=Is it not rather a temptation that I wish to abandon all the joys of earth and prepare something for myself there where perhaps there is nothing ? ’ And he became horrified and filled with disgust at himself . ‘ Vile creature !
#Text=And it is you who wish to become a saint ! ’ he upbraided himself , and he began to pray .
#Text=But as soon as he started to pray he saw himself vividly as he had been at the Monastery , in a majestic post in biretta and mantle , and he shook his head . ‘ No , that is not right .
#Text=It is deception .
#Text=I may deceive others , but not myself or God .
#Text=I am not a majestic man , but a pitiable and ridiculous one ! ’ And he threw back the folds of his cassock and smiled as he looked at his thin legs in their underclothing .
